reviews.review_msg: When I tell you I have never seen a prof this disorganized... boy do I mean it. Her grading criteria is super vague and she always expects more than what the question asked for. Assignments are not correctly set up so it took us 4 weeks to hand in ONE of them. Uses big words to explain the simplest ideas and somehow fails to get them across. AVOID

Good prof, willing to work with students so they can get the most out of the material. Participating in class will absolutely help you in the long run. Open book midterm so annotate your textbook and take detailed notes!
Took this class thinking it would be interesting and easy but Deborah is so boring and marks harder then is necessary.

Debbie is a quiet yet firm  leader. Some may find her lectures to be  dull, but she makes the effort to make the subject matter relatable and will draw on her own life to do so. She truly cares about her students and their success, and tries to create a classroom environment where everyone has the opportunity to participate in discussion.

Caring, approachable, passionate about the topic, and fair. I appreciate Deborah's approach to teaching- she certainly stands out amongst the rest. She's comfortable and confident in her gentleness, and incredibly diplomatic. Fair grader, interesting group discussions and lectures. Assignments could use more instruction.

I only got to attend two lectures because I had to drop due to time conflict but I wish I could stay in this class. Just the first two classes were so interesting to learn about families. Highly recommended, sad I couldn't stay but gonna try again in future
